@Pogue The Internet’s ability to criticize things that don’t exist yet is incredible. Five minutes ago it didn’t exist. Now it’s a hole?
To be clear: the iPhone’s fingerprint reader is an OPTIONAL security feature. And your fingerprint is not sent or stored online.
You guys crack me up. You’re all freaked out, calling the iPhone 5S fingerprint sensor a security HOLE!? How’s it any worse than a password?
iPhone 5S and 5C release date: Sept. 20. Prices for 5S are the same as always: $200, $300, $400 (16, 32, 64 gigs).
To wake the iPhone 5S, you just touch the Home button; it scans your fingerprint. Also works to make iTunes purchases instead of a password.
As rumored: the iPhone 5S’s Home button is a fingerprint reader. Apple calls it Touch ID. You can teach it different fingers. Any angle.
iPhone 5S also has 10 frames-per-second burst mode, and 120 frames-per-second slow motion video.
iPhone 5S has TWO flashes: white+amber. Together, they adjust the color tone of the flash to match the scene. World’s first, Apple says.
iPhone 5S has new camera: new f2.2 lens, 15% larger sensor, BIGGER pixels (yay!).
iPhone 5S has a new “motion coprocessor” chip for real-time processing of accelerometer, gyro, and compass data, for better fitness apps.
And now, the new iPhone 5S: in black, gray, or gold. New A7 chip—first 64-bit chip in a phone, Apple says.
(yes, I meant “you’re being a bad influency.” Damned autocorrect!)
Ugh. Stop saying “translucency,” Apple. The word is “translucence.” You’re being a bad influence.
iPhone 5C: $100 for 16-gig model, $200 for 32-gig model. With contract, of course. Plastic Apple cases for your plastic iPhone: $30. (Why?)
Here it is: the iPhone 5C. As predicted: available in 5 colors (+matching wallpaper). Plastic body. Guts mostly same as iPhone 5.
Starting today, all of Apple’s iOS apps—Pages, Numbers, iPhoto, iMovie, etc—will be free on a new iPhone/iPad/Touch.

Mysteries of #Gravity: When Clooney releases Bullock's tether, he drifts away. In zero-G a single tug brings them together.
